intro: Bertiera bistipulata, commonly known as the two-lobed bertiera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows up to 3 meters in height. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are often borne on short pedicels. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a distinctive two-lobed base, giving it its specific epithet. The plant is part of the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus species.
